location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from George Skipp, in Schyras [Shiraz], to James Morley, East India Company Resident at Bushire, and his assistant, George Green

physicalDescription.extent: Condition: there is a small, dark stain (ink?) in the centre of f. 23 that obscures some text.

mods.abstract: The letter describes how Karim Khan yet again gave the author assurances the he will assist the English in their attack on Carrack [Kharg] Island with 7000 men under the command of his half-brother, Zackey Caun [ZƒÅki Khan Zand], and then yet again went back on those assurances. Skipp expresses his fears and frustrations throughout the letter.
